We also try a protocol that, like the Random walk in the previous section, was developed to cost-efficiently identify high-degree nodes in social media. We call it the Two-step heuristic. Just like Random walk it has a parameter to tune the amount of information used in the search process [ 17]. This protocol consist of two stages. In the first stage, one randomly chooses n 1 nodes and considers a reduced network of these n 1 nodes and their neighbors. In the second stage one measures the exact degrees of the n 2 highest-degree nodes of the reduced network. For simplicity, we set n 1 = n 2 = n (which is not far off the expected optimal parameter setting [ 17]). This gives n( f, G) = 2 n, and the total information cost 2 nc
